definition: physical pain/lit. skin and flesh suffer
torture/corporal punishment (traditionally involving mutilation or amputation)
beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)
to suffer beating/fig. to be severely criticized/to take a hammering
to confess one's fault/to accept one's punishment
to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
see 將功贖罪|将功赎罪[jiang1 gong1 shu2 zui4]
the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
lit. to punish a little to prevent a lot (idiom); to criticize former mistakes firmly to prevent large scale repetition
